de.polygonal.core.fmt.NumberFormat

type
class

Various utility functions for formatting numbers.

Static Methods

centToEuro(x : Int, ?decimalSeparator : String, ?thousandsSeparator : String) : String

parameters
decimalSeparator a character to use as a decimal separator. The default value is ",".
thousandsSeparator a character to use as a thousands separator. The default value is ".".
Euro cent to Euro conversion.

groupDigits(x : Int, ?thousandsSeparator : String) : String

parameters
thousandsSeparator a character to use as a thousands separator. The default value is ".".
Groups the digits in the input number by using a thousands separator.
E.g. the number 1024 is converted to the string '1.024'.

toBin(x : Int, ?byteDelimiter : String, ?leadingZeros : Bool) : String

parameters
byteDelimiter a character to insert between bytes. The default value is an empty string.
Returns a string representation of the unsigned integer x in binary notation.

toFixed(x : Float, decimalPlaces : Int) : String

parameters
decimalPlaces the number of decimal places.
Returns a string representation of the number x in fixed-point notation.

toHex(x : Int) : String

Returns a string representation of the unsigned integer x in hexadecimal notation.

toMMSS(x : Float) : String

Converts x measured in seconds to MM:SS.

toOct(x : Int) : String

Returns a string representation of the number in octadecimal notation.

toRadix(x : Int, radix : Int) : String

Same as int.toString(radix) in ActionScript 3.0.
